attributes.action: Hold back article 50 until police investigation of 2015 election completed.
attributes.additional_details: There are many references in the public domain about the police investigation which can easily be found on the internet.  Several forces have asked for a further 12 months to complete the investigation.  If the Conservative majority was invalid then possibly the calling of a referendum was not valid and we should have another general election before considering invoking article 50  to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Several Conservative MP's are being investigated for electoral expenses fraud which potentially could alter the result of the election and therefore possibly invalidate the calling of a referendum on Britain's membership of the EU.  I understand that police have asked for a further 12 months

rejection.details:
It's not clear what 2015 general election expenses have to do with the 2016 EU referendum. If you want a second referendum, you could sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133753

If you want the EU referendum to be declared null and void, you could sign this petition: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/139789
